references:
Notation:
We use boldface letters (e.g., 𝐱𝐱\mathbf{x}), non-boldface letters (e.g., x𝑥x or X𝑋X), and calligraphic letters (e.g., 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}) to represent vectors, scalar constants, and sets, respectively.
∥⋅∥2\|\cdot\|_{2}, 𝔼​[⋅]𝔼delimited-[]⋅\mathbb{E}[\cdot], and 𝕀​[⋅]𝕀delimited-[]⋅\mathbb{I}[\cdot] represent the l2subscript𝑙2l_{2}-norm, expectation, and indicator function, respectively.
|⋅||\cdot| represents the cardinality of a set.
⟨⋅,⋅⟩⋅⋅\langle\cdot,\cdot\rangle represents the inner product of two vectors.
The set of real numbers, positive real numbers, and positive integers are denoted by ℝℝ\mathbb{R}, ℝ++subscriptℝabsent\mathbb{R}_{++}, and ℤ++subscriptℤabsent\mathbb{Z}_{++}, respectively.
The zero vector and all-ones vector are represented by 𝟎0\mathbf{0} and 𝟏1\mathbf{1}, respectively.
The key notation used in this paper is listed in Table I.
